title: Housing Boom and College Choice
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

A new study finds that lower- and middle-class families whose housing value increased during the boom of the late ’90s and early 2000s sent their children to expensive colleges they otherwise couldn’t afford.

","type":"text/html"},{"type":"text/html","content":"
"},{"type":"text/html","content":"

Guest: C. Lockwood Reynolds, Asst. Professor of Economics, Kent State University

"},{"type":"text/html","content":"
"},{"content":"

For more on this study, please visit: http://www.nber.org/papers/w18075

","type":"text/html"},{"type":"text/html","content":"
"}]
contentencoded:
A new study finds that lower- and middle-class families whose housing value increased during the boom of the late ’90s and early 2000s sent their children to expensive colleges they otherwise couldn’t afford.


Guest: C. Lockwood Reynolds, Asst. Professor of Economics, Kent State University


For more on this study, please visit: http://www.nber.org/papers/w18075
